item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, October 21, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. An amateur historian has discovered a long-lost short story by Bram Stoker (201 points | 81 comments)
2. Thought experiments that fray the fabric of space-time (35 points | 39 comments)
3. Overengineering a way to know if people are in my university's CS lab (95 points | 43 comments)
4. Show HN: Epublifier – scrape pages (books, manuals) for offline reading (230 points | 39 comments)
5. Please do not write below the line (206 points | 190 comments)
6. Show HN: Floating point arithmetic types in C++ for any size and any base (51 points | 20 comments)
7. Transitioning the Use of Cryptographic Algorithms and Key Lengths (11 points | 1 comment)

10. The near impossible literacy test Louisiana used to suppress the black vote (19 points | 3 comments)

14. Scientists working to decode birdsong (129 points | 111 comments)

20. First Images from Euclid Are In (7 points | discuss)
21. ByteDance sacks intern for sabotaging AI project (108 points | 135 comments)
22. Plankton balloon to six times size in newly discovered mode of oceanic travel (79 points | 10 comments)
23. Microsoft is introducing hidden APIs to VS Code only enabled for Copilot (303 points | 158 comments)
24. "The Secret History of the Mongols": A digital history approach (47 points | 11 comments)
25. T-Mobile, AT&T oppose unlocking rule, claim locked phones are good for users (166 points | 134 comments)
26. Jiga (YC W21) Is Hiring a Full Stack Engineer (React/Mongo/Node) ( | hide)
27. Vanity of Vanities: Fool's Cap Map of the World (Ca. 1585) (10 points | discuss)

29. Turing and the Primes (2016) [pdf] (19 points | 3 comments)
